intro: Genistella umbellata, commonly known as the clustered genista, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, umbel-like clusters, giving it its scientific name. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
